greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array read by rows: T(n,k) = Fibonacci(k)*C(n,k), k = 1...n; n>=1.
comment: Let F(n) denote the n-th Fibonacci number (A000045). Then n-th row sum of T is F(2n) and n-th alternating row sum is F(n).
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 1..100 of triangle, flattened
maple: with(combinat); seq(seq(binomial(n,k)*fibonacci(k), k=1..n), n=1..12); # _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 30 2019
mathematica: Table[Fibonacci[k]*Binomial[n, k], {n, 12}, {k, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 30 2019 *)
program: for(n=1,12, for(k=1,n, print1(T(n,k), ", "))) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 30 2019
(MAGMA) [Binomial(n,k)*Fibonacci(k): k in [1..n], n in [1..12]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 30 2019
(Sage) [[binomial(n,k)*fibonacci(k) for k in (1..n)] for n in (1..12)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 30 2019
(GAP) Flat(List([1..12], n-> List([1..n], k-> Binomial(n,k)*Fibonacci(k) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 30 2019
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, May 03 2004
